text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kira was born in Usuki on July 5, 1991. After graduating from Kamimura Gakuen High School, she joined for Urawa Reds in 2010. She was selected Best Young Player awards in 2011 season. She played for the club 157 matches and scored 52 goals. She left the club end of 2019 season. In December 2020, she signed with Melbourne City. In August 2008, Kira was selected the Japan U-17 national team for 2008 U-17 World Cup. She played 3 games and scored 4 goals. On May 8, 2014, she debuted for the Japan national team against New Zealand. She was a member of Japan for 2014 Asian Cup and 2014 Asian Games. Japan won the championship at Asian Cup and the 2nd place at Asian Games. She played 12 games and scored 5 goals for Japan in 2014. ==Statistics== List of match in 2014 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2014 12 5 Total 12 5 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Oita Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds Ladies players Category:2014 AFC Women's Asian Cup players Category:Footballers at the 2014 Asian Games Category:AFC Women's Asian Cup-winning players Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 2014 Asian Games
title: Chinatsu Kira
